name: Granzella's Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception friendly and efficient. Room large and comfortable, quiet for a good sleep. Handy for Pool, towels provided.
reviews.title: A good overnighter, but not much to hang around for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't see much in Williams but thei was a convenient overnight stop. Diner a bit disappointing.
reviews.title: Perfectly happy with our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Colusa worth a short visit, about 9 miles east.
reviews.title: Great New Look

reviews.text: I read the other reviews before making our reservation and feel compelled to leave my own review. We were attending an event at the restaurant and wanted to be able to safely walk to where we were staying after. Given that we were just getting up and going in the morning, I figured it was worth the risk after reading the mixed reviews. I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere and we had a lovely, clean room. The desk staff was pleasant checking in and out, and while we had no special needs or issues, I must say that I was completely satisfied. I would be happy to stay there again and my husband feels the same. I said only very good because our stay was too brief for more.
reviews.title: Lovely room, bad smell...

reviews.text: I am sitting in there new remodel hotel room, it's beautiful and they love pets too. They started remodeling the rooms about 6 weeks ago! Lovely, new upscale furnishings, flat screen TV, nice in room amenites by blue Ribbon supplier and in room Refrigrator. I had seen the negative reports and was disappointed but thought we would try one more time. Sure glad we did! Still get your coupons for the free sour dough bread and 10% off your dinner, lunch or breakfast, can't beat it! It will contiune too stay hear when traveling back and forth from our summer and winter places! Jeanne from WA & AZ
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, quiet and convenient

reviews.text: We needed to stay in Williams overnight for an event in town, so we chose Granzellas. We've been to the restaurant and the deli many times and always been pleased with the service, so we decided to try the hotel. What a find! It was great. I never expected to find such nice accomodations in that area. The hotel is clean and comfortable, very quiet. I definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were tentative about staying in a relatively unkown hotel, but we were very glad we stayed at Granzella's Inn. The room was top notch, beautiful bedding, nice large flatscreen. Hotel was quiet and spotless, front desk very friendly. Breakfast offered us yogurt, cereals, bagels, juice, coffee, waffles....the usual complimentary fare. The worker actually used gloves and tongs to move the baked goods around, we were impressed! The only downfall of the place is the pool, so if you expect to sit by a gorgeous pool you will be unhappy. We would definitely stay there again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Yes we loved it!

reviews.text: A family owned very Comfortable Hotel. The rooms are very spacios, King Beds, Desk Large Flat Screen TV and a wonderful refurnished bathroom. The complimentary Breakfast lets some of the larger Hotels a thing of the past.
reviews.title: Large Parking For RV'S and a wonderful bathroom

reviews.text: Arrived with no reservation and was able to handle the room down 25 %.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large Parking lot accross the street for Truck and RV. You become a gift card for a free loaf of Homemade Bread at thier street accross the street.
reviews.title: Very clean and comfortable with great food at the bar and restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel is clean, functional, and it offers spacious rooms. But, that's where the good news stops. The service style of the front desk people made guest feel uncomfortable, and they actually made me want to walk out the door - the only reason I didn't was because I was too exhausted to drive any more. The bedspreads, amenities, and furnishings were clean but very, very cheap. If you just want to sleep, this place is fine.
reviews.title: Very Weird Front Desk Service

reviews.text: My husband and I have been staying at Granzella's since they built their motel. I have never once encountered anything that would warrant a visit or call to the desk to complain.
reviews.title: Shocked at some of the reviews!

reviews.text: To say that the rooms are full of dog hair or feces on the bed spreads is beyond belief. I would say that that particular reviewer has other motives for posting such a thing. I find it unbelievable.
reviews.title: No functional Internet Connection

likes.disliked: — poor staff addittude and poor internet service

reviews.text: The wifi has always worked for me, in fact, I am writing this review as I sit in my clean room eating my continental breakfast. So is it possible that the reviewer may not be familiar with their computer and could not get it to work- did they ask for help?
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the matter of the continental breakfast- you can spend $115 at a Holiday Inn Express and get a fairly complete breakfast included in your room. Note the price difference; all that food needs to be paid for, it's not free, just "included in your stay."
reviews.title: Granzella's going down

likes.liked: — entrance through lobby, electricity & running hot water, nice staff

reviews.text: The person we booked with at Granzella's was very pleasant on the phone and gave us upgraded, connecting rooms for the same price as regular rooms. We were looking forward to our stay. On the outside, the motel is modern and appealing, and, at first glance, our rooms seemed to be average motel rooms, although my friends' room smelled musty. Imagine our shock when we found dog hair, feces, and blood on the blanket on one of the beds in their room! It was late in the evening, so we took the blanket down to the front desk, where the clerk said, "That's disgusting" and handed us new bedding. Apparently, the hunters, with dogs, who stay in the hotel sometimes clean ducks on the beds! But why wouldn't the maid have noticed when she was (supposedly) putting on clean bedding for the next guest's stay? The hotel has only one clerk at night, and she did not offer to help change the bed or offer to move my friends to a different room. My friends decided not to ask for a new room, and they changed the bed themselves, but now we were understandably concerned about the cleanliness of the rooms in general. Upon checkout, I informed the desk clerk that we would not be staying at Granzella's again.
reviews.title: Reconsider your choice

likes.disliked: — The filthy bedding had not been changed from prior guests

reviews.text: We stayed here one night while traveling. They gave us a discounted rate, as we arrived at 8 pm. It is a lovely old hotel--hardwood floors and doors that use keys! It has a quaint feel and was quiet and clean.
reviews.title: Nice, historic hotel

reviews.text: This is such a cute, mom and pop hotel. I don't know if it is family owned and operated, but it feels that way! the hotel is charming and comfortable and the adjacent restaurant (also called Granzella's) has the best baked goods. The staff was so helpful and organized. And it is pet friendly...a big plus. I would encourage anyone who is passing through in I-5 to stop here and stay a while.
reviews.title: Family owned treasure

description: Top to Bottom renovation completed in 2010! Perfect location with famous Granzella's Restaurant, Lounge, Deli, and Gift Shop! Your perfect "half-way" stop on Interstate 5! **DOG FRIENDLY!!!!!
